turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Securitas depot robbery.
turn.1: What happened in the Securitas depot robbery?
turn.2: On 1 June 2010, Murray was jailed in Morocco for ten years for his part in the robbery; the sentence was later increased to 25 years.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: Kent Police Detective Superintendent Keith Judge said "I'm pleased that Murray has now been held accountable." Time Inc. announced on 4 August 2008 that they would be making a film about Murray's alleged role in the robbery, based on an article about him in "Sports Illustrated" called "Breaking the Bank".
turn.5: Did the film ever come out?
turn.6: In addition to the robbery, the film will also concentrate on his life, including his mixed martial arts career.
turn.7: What else happened with the robbery?
turn.8: In February 2013, Malcolm Constable, who was believed by his brother Derek to be associated with the robbery, was found dead of a self-inflicted shotgun wound.
turn.9: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.10: Kent Police stated they had no record of any incidents involving Constable.
turn.12: On 11 July 2019, Paul Allen was shot and severely injured at his home in north London - a house he was renting from comedian Russell Kane.
